technology: There were no technical difficulties during the conversation.
cur_neg_affect: The participant expresses some skepticism and concern regarding the vaccine, but it is not overly negative.
past_neg_affect: The participant describes a very anxiety filled time and the isolation that he felt during the pandemic, and also the death of his grandmother and uncle.
communal_orientation: The participant is polite and engaged, acknowledging the other person's perspective and sharing his own experiences.
engagement: The participant is actively engaged in the conversation, sharing his experiences and opinions and responding to the other person's comments.

perspective_statements.transcript: Yeah, absolutely. I could see that perspective.
And, you know, I, get it completely. I understand why somebody would want to get vaccinated.

I understand, especially with the effort that the media and health care industry as well as the government made and trying to get people vaccinated trying to educate people as to why it's important to get vaccinated.

vaccine_importance: The participant does not believe that vaccines are important for him personally, but he acknowledges that they may be important for others.
booster_importance: The participant does not believe that boosters are important and states that he will not be getting any in the future.
cognitive_complexity: The participant demonstrates some cognitive complexity by considering different perspectives and acknowledging the complexities of the situation.
general_notes: The participant is skeptical of the healthcare industry and vaccines due to historical events and personal beliefs. He is respectful of others' choices but firm in his own decision not to get vaccinated or boosted.
